news.Title: [AI Summary] 世界 (5347) 董事會決議多項重大財務佈局，包含子公司增資、發行海外轉換公司債及資本支出
news.Content:
• 世界 (5347) 董事會通過多項重大財務決議，包括對新加坡子公司增資及代子公司進行現金增資，顯示對海外營運的積極佈局。
• 公司同時決定發行海外無擔保轉換公司債，募集資金將用於購料、設備、廠務及海外投資，並核准機器設備資本預算。

台灣半導體廠世界（5347）於 2025 年 12 月 5 日召開董事會，通過多項重大財務佈局，展現公司積極拓展營運及強化財務結構的策略。首先，董事會同意對其新加坡子公司 VANGUARD INTERNATIONAL SEMICONDUCTOR SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. 進行 4500 萬美元的增資[1](http://...)，以支持子公司營運需求。此外，世界也代其重要子公司 VisionPower Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Pte. Ltd. 公告現金增資基準日，該子公司將辦理 2.4 億美元的現金增資，資金用途為公司營運需求，且將由原股東全數認購[2](http://...)。

為支應多元化的資金需求，世界董事會也通過發行海外第一次無擔保轉換公司債，發行總額以 3.5 億美元為上限，票面利率暫定為年利率 0%，發行期間暫定為 5 年。募集資金將用於支應外幣購料、購置機器設備及廠務設施、償還銀行借款以及轉投資海外子公司等[3](http://...)。同時，董事會也核准了機器設備及相關廠務設備的資本預算，總金額為新台幣 558 佰萬元，交易相對人包含多家國內外設備供應商[5](http://...)。這些決策顯示世界在擴張產能、優化資本結構及支持海外業務發展方面，正採取一系列積極的行動。

news.Title: [AI Summary] Vanguard (5347) Board Approves Major Financial Initiatives Including Subsidiary Capital Injection, Overseas Convertible Bond Issuance, and Capital Expenditures
news.Content:
• • Vanguard (5347) board approved significant financial moves, including capital injections into its Singaporean subsidiary and a major cash increase for VisionPower Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Pte. Ltd.
• • The company will also issue US$350 million in overseas convertible bonds and has approved capital expenditures for machinery and plant facilities.
• Full English Article: Vanguard (5347), a Taiwanese semiconductor manufacturer, announced on December 5, 2025, a series of significant financial resolutions passed by its board of directors. These strategic decisions underscore the company's commitment to expanding operations and strengthening its financial foundation. The board approved a capital injection of US$45 million into its Singaporean subsidiary, VANGUARD INTERNATIONAL SEMICONDUCTOR SINGAPORE PTE. LTD., to support its operational needs[1](http://...). Concurrently, Vanguard announced on behalf of its key subsidiary, VisionPower Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Pte. Ltd., that it will undertake a US$240 million cash capital increase, with the funds designated for the subsidiary's operational requirements and to be fully subscribed by existing shareholders[2](http://...).

To further finance its diverse capital needs, Vanguard's board also authorized the issuance of its first overseas unsecured convertible bonds, with a maximum issuance amount of US$350 million. These bonds will have a provisional coupon rate of 0% per annum and a term of approximately five years. The proceeds are earmarked for foreign currency procurement, acquisition of machinery and plant facilities, repayment of bank loans, and overseas subsidiary investments[3](http://...). In addition to these financing activities, the board approved a capital budget of NT$558 million for machinery and related plant equipment, with transactions involving several domestic and international equipment suppliers[5](http://...). These comprehensive measures indicate Vanguard's proactive approach to capacity expansion, capital structure optimization, and support for its overseas business development.
